snippet: A new study shows that consumers are still being kept in the dark about overdraft fees. These costly games will continue until regulators require banks to provide clear, concise pricing information.
abstract: Editorial calls on the federal Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to bring further transparency to debit card banking; cites study finding that banks are still intentionally keeping consumers in the dark about fee information.
lead_paragraph: A new study shows that consumers are still being kept in the dark about overdraft fees. These costly games will continue until regulators require banks to provide clear, concise pricing information.

headline.seo: More Debit Card Follies and Abuses
headline.main: More Debit Card Follies and Abuses
headline.print_headline: More Debit Card Follies and Abuses
